description: Lists the active violations for a given Device Defender security profile. Requires permission to access the ListActiveViolations action.

nested_items.name: activeViolations
nested_items.description: The list of active violations.

nested_items.name: violationId
nested_items.description: The ID of the active violation.

nested_items.name: thingName
nested_items.description: The name of the thing responsible for the active violation.

nested_items.name: securityProfileName
nested_items.description: The security profile with the behavior is in violation.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name you've given to the behavior.

nested_items.name: metric
nested_items.description: What is measured by the behavior.

nested_items.name: metricDimension
nested_items.description: The dimension for a metric in your behavior. For example, using a TOPIC_FILTER dimension, you can narrow down the scope of the metric to only MQTT topics where the name matches the pattern specified in the dimension. This can't be used with custom metrics.

nested_items.name: dimensionName
nested_items.description: A unique identifier for the dimension.

nested_items.name: operator
nested_items.description: Defines how the dimensionValues of a dimension are interpreted. For example, for dimension type TOPIC_FILTER, the IN operator, a message will be counted only if its topic matches one of the topic filters. With NOT_IN operator, a message will be counted only if it doesn't match any of the topic filters. The operator is optional: if it's not provided (is null), it will be interpreted as IN.

nested_items.name: comparisonOperator
nested_items.description: The operator that relates the thing measured ( metric) to the criteria (containing a value or statisticalThreshold). Valid operators include:
string-list: in-set and not-in-set.
number-list: in-set and not-in-set.
ip-address-list: in-cidr-set and not-in-cidr-set.
number: less-than, less-than-equals, greater-than, and greater-than-equals.

nested_items.name: count
nested_items.description: If the comparisonOperator calls for a numeric value, use this to specify that numeric value to be compared with the metric.

nested_items.name: cidrs
nested_items.description: If the comparisonOperator calls for a set of CIDRs, use this to specify that set to be compared with the metric.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ports
nested_items.description: If the comparisonOperator calls for a set of ports, use this to specify that set to be compared with the metric.
(integer) ---

nested_items.name: number
nested_items.description: The numeral value of a metric.

nested_items.name: numbers
nested_items.description: The numeral values of a metric.
(float) ---

nested_items.name: strings
nested_items.description: The string values of a metric.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: durationSeconds
nested_items.description: Use this to specify the time duration over which the behavior is evaluated, for those criteria that have a time dimension (for example, NUM_MESSAGES_SENT). For a statisticalThreshhold metric comparison, measurements from all devices are accumulated over this time duration before being used to calculate percentiles, and later, measurements from an individual device are also accumulated over this time duration before being given a percentile rank. Cannot be used with list-based metric datatypes.

nested_items.name: consecutiveDatapointsToAlarm
nested_items.description: If a device is in violation of the behavior for the specified number of consecutive datapoints, an alarm occurs. If not specified, the default is 1.

nested_items.name: consecutiveDatapointsToClear
nested_items.description: If an alarm has occurred and the offending device is no longer in violation of the behavior for the specified number of consecutive datapoints, the alarm is cleared. If not specified, the default is 1.

nested_items.name: statisticalThreshold
nested_items.description: A statistical ranking (percentile)that indicates a threshold value by which a behavior is determined to be in compliance or in violation of the behavior.

nested_items.name: statistic
nested_items.description: The percentile that resolves to a threshold value by which compliance with a behavior is determined. Metrics are collected over the specified period ( durationSeconds) from all reporting devices in your account and statistical ranks are calculated. Then, the measurements from a device are collected over the same period. If the accumulated measurements from the device fall above or below ( comparisonOperator) the value associated with the percentile specified, then the device is considered to be in compliance with the behavior, otherwise a violation occurs.

nested_items.name: mlDetectionConfig
nested_items.description: The configuration of an ML Detect.

nested_items.name: confidenceLevel
nested_items.description: The sensitivity of anomalous behavior evaluation. Can be Low, Medium, or High.

nested_items.name: suppressAlerts
nested_items.description: Suppresses alerts.

nested_items.name: exportMetric
nested_items.description: Value indicates exporting metrics related to the behavior when it is true.

nested_items.name: lastViolationValue
nested_items.description: The value of the metric (the measurement) that caused the most recent violation.

nested_items.name: count
nested_items.description: If the comparisonOperator calls for a numeric value, use this to specify that numeric value to be compared with the metric.

nested_items.name: cidrs
nested_items.description: If the comparisonOperator calls for a set of CIDRs, use this to specify that set to be compared with the metric.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ports
nested_items.description: If the comparisonOperator calls for a set of ports, use this to specify that set to be compared with the metric.
(integer) ---

nested_items.name: number
nested_items.description: The numeral value of a metric.

nested_items.name: numbers
nested_items.description: The numeral values of a metric.
(float) ---

nested_items.name: strings
nested_items.description: The string values of a metric.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: violationEventAdditionalInfo
nested_items.description: The details of a violation event.

nested_items.name: confidenceLevel
nested_items.description: The sensitivity of anomalous behavior evaluation. Can be Low, Medium, or High.

nested_items.name: verificationState
nested_items.description: The verification state of the violation (detect alarm).

nested_items.name: verificationStateDescription
nested_items.description: The description of the verification state of the violation.

nested_items.name: lastViolationTime
nested_items.description: The time the most recent violation occurred.

nested_items.name: violationStartTime
nested_items.description: The time the violation started.

nested_items.name: nextToken
nested_items.description: A token that can be used to retrieve the next set of results, or null if there are no additional results.
